title: [Large-Scale] Cultural Foundations of Classroom Research and Applications in Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic concepts of science education experiences and instructional design
context.additional_context: Experiences the lesson research process through VR simulations, utilizing smartphone-based collaborative tools

learning_goals: Learners analyze ≥3 cultural case studies of Lesson Study practices in Japan and Finland, proposing ≥2 actionable strategies with implementation plans for corporate science education programs (e.g., R&D capability workshops).
In a 2-week simulation, learners collaborate with 3 peer instructors to derive ≥2 curriculum improvement plans, demonstrating ≥20% enhancement via pre-post comparative evaluation tables.

Learners analyze ≥3 VR classroom scenarios reflecting Korean, American, and Japanese cultural characteristics and execute a research process meeting ≥4 of 5 cultural-context-aware instructional design checklist items.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
